subject: Philosophy
title: Marcus Aurelius: The Philosopher King
description: One-minute skill: Marcus Aurelius: The Philosopher King.

hook.text: The most powerful man on Earth kept a private journal reminding himself he was nothing special.

buildup.text: Marcus Aurelius ruled Rome for nearly twenty years while battling wars, plagues, and betrayals.

discovery.text: His Meditations were never meant to be published. They're raw self-talk from a man trying to stay good.

twist.text: He had every reason to be arrogant. Instead, he wrote reminders to be humble, patient, and just.

climax.text: Plato dreamed of philosopher kings. Marcus came closest â€” and still doubted himself daily.

punchline.text: Power tested him. His journal kept him honest.

quiz.question: Why are Marcus Aurelius's Meditations remarkable?
options: They were private notes to himself, not for publication
They predicted the fall of Rome
